alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 08 at 11:33AM AKST until November 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Wintery mix of precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches with locally higher amounts along the Anchorage Hillside. Heavy rain on snow and ice tonight and Thursday morning. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow this morning is expected to become heavier by mid to late afternoon. Several inches of snow accumulation is expected through late Wednesday evening before a changeover to rain. The rain could be heavy overnight causing very slick roads with rain on ice as well as ponding of water. There is a chance the precipitation type remains mostly snow which would result in higher snowfall amounts, but it looks more likely rain will be the predominant precipitation type tonight into Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
